channel.title: How to Make Server Say Somthing?
channel.description: Ok so how do i make it so the server can give like little notes because i want it to say Vote For Us At Codefasga.com/status! So every1 can hear withour me having to type it

item.title: How to Make Server Say Somthing?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[code]Search for:

boolean process()

Above it, put:

public int annTimer = 0;

Under boolean process() put:

if(annTimer >= 0) {
annTimer--;
}

if(annTimer <= 1) {
annTimer = 500;
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Vote For Us At Codefasga.com/status!";
}

Try that.

[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: How to Make Server Say Somthing?

item.title: How to Make Server Say Somthing?
item.dc:creator: @major492 major492
item.source: How to Make Server Say Somthing?

item.title: How to Make Server Say Somthing?
item.dc:creator: @jags_4 jags 4
item.description:
@jags_4 wrote:

1.Ok, first off run your server and find a character that says something, eg On my server santa says “Get your rares here”

2.Open up your source file and then open up NPChandler.java

  1. Then hit CTRL+f and search for “…” eg for me it would be “Get your rares here”

  2. Then just delete “get your rares here” and add “Vote for us at Codefasga.com/status”

EXAMPLE:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 2262) { // dark mage bloke
if (misc.random2(30) == 1) {
npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdate = “Get your skillcapes here!”;
}

change the “get your skill capes here!” to…

if (npcs[i].npcType == 2262) { // dark mage bloke
if (misc.random2(30) == 1) {
npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdate = "Vote for us at Codefasga.com/status!";
}

Then just compile and run your server.

Read full topic
